175.title: AAP leader climbs tower after being denied ticket in MCD polls
175.article_body: AAP's former councillor Haseeb-ul-Hasan climbed a high-tension tower in Delhi's Shastri Park on Sunday after he was denied a ticket for the upcoming MCD polls. A video of the incident has surfaced. He claimed that AAP kept all the documents which he had submitted hoping to get a ticket. On Saturday, AAP released its final list of 117 candidates.

176.title: Hyd-origin man wins US' North Carolina senate race, elected 3rd time
176.article_body: Mujtaba Mohammed, whose family hails from Hyderabad, won the North Carolina senate race in the US. "I have officially been re-elected to my third term in the North Carolina senate," he tweeted after the results of mid-term elections were announced. Mohammed's parents lived in Hyderabad and migrated to the US in the 1980s. He will represent Mecklenburg County's 38th district.

177.title: Gurugram Police arrest 5 for abducting, sexually assaulting 30-year-old man
177.article_body: The Gurugram Police arrested five people for allegedly abducting and sexually assaulting a 30-year-old man after he failed to repay ₹2 lakh, borrowed from one of the accused. According to the police, the accused took the victim to Manesar, forced him to consume alcohol and then assaulted him. The accused also broke the victim's mobile phone and stole his car.

178.title: Hate & kill, then fete & reward: Mahua on BJP's poll ticket to Godhra MLA
178.article_body: While speaking about the Bharatiya Janata Party giving a poll ticket to Godhra MLA, Chandrasinh Kanaksinh Raulji, who had earlier called Bilkis Bano's rapists 'sanskari', TMC leader Mahua Moitra said that "this is the Gujarat Model". "Godhra MLA who called Bilkis case rapists & killers 'Sanskari Brahmins' is re-nominated by BJP...Hate & Kill. Then Fete & Reward," she tweeted.

179.title: England to field first in T20 World Cup 2022 final vs Pakistan, playing XIs out
179.article_body: England captain Jos Buttler won the toss and elected to field first in T20 World Cup 2022 final against Pakistan. Both England and Pakistan are fielding the same playing XIs that featured in the semi-finals. Pakistan are playing a T20 World Cup final after 13 years, while England are featuring in T20 World Cup final after six years.

180.title: BJP busy distorting history, why can't Tipu's statue be built: Siddaramaiah
180.article_body: Former Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah gave his approval a day after Congress MLA Tanveer Sait promised to build a 100-foot-tall Tipu Sultan's statue and accused the BJP of distorting history. "Why can't Tipu's statue be built? Let them build, doesn't he deserve it? [The] BJP twists history. What did they say about...Ambedkar and others? They say false things," said Siddaramaiah.

181.title: Entire village on sale for ₹2 crore in Spain; pic surfaces
181.article_body: The entire Spanish village, Salto de Castro, is on sale for €260,000 (roughly ₹2 crore). The village reportedly has 44 homes, a hotel, a church, a school, a municipal swimming pool, a sports area and an old Civil Guard barracks. "I'm selling because I'm an urban-dweller and cannot maintain the upkeep," the man who bought the village in 2000s said.

182.title: No foul play in his death: Rajev on Siddhaanth Vir Surryavanshi
182.article_body: Actor Rajev Paul said that there "was no foul play" in the death of Siddhaanth Vir Surryavanshi, who passed away on Friday at the age of 46. Rajev added that he has "lost a brother" and shared that he was "genuinely very careful of his diet". "His daughter is my godchild. Maybe it was just his time," he mentioned.

183.title: Bring the trophy home, lads: Harry Kane, coach Southgate on Eng's T20 WC final
183.article_body: England men's football team manager Gareth Southgate and captain Harry Kane took to social media to send their best wishes to the England men's cricket team for their T20 World Cup final against Pakistan today. "We will be watching and hopefully, you can bring that trophy home. The whole country is behind you," said Kane.

184.title: Info Edge's net profit falls 97.99% to ₹168 cr in September quarter
184.article_body: Naukri-parent Info Edge recorded a fall of 97.99% year-on-year in its net profit to ₹168.10 crore in the September quarter. Its revenue increased by 51.22% to ₹531.82 crore in the quarter, up from ₹351.68 crore in the corresponding quarter last fiscal. Info Edge's total income stood at ₹581.75 crore, 47% up from ₹395.72 crore recorded a year ago.

185.title: Who has hit the most sixes in a T20 World Cup final?
185.article_body: Ex-West Indies all-rounder Marlon Samuels holds the record for smashing most sixes in a T20 World Cup final. He slammed six sixes against Sri Lanka in 2012 final against Sri Lanka. He's followed by Pakistan's Misbah-ul-Haq, India's Virat Kohli, West Indies' Carlos Brathwaite and Australia's Mitchell Marsh, who slammed four sixes each in 2007, 2014, 2016 and 2021 finals, respectively.

186.title: Who have won 'Player of the Match' award in finals in T20 World Cup history?
186.article_body: Ex-India all-rounder Irfan Pathan was named Player of the Match in T20 World Cup final in 2007. Ex-Pakistan captain Shahid Afridi won it in 2009. In 2010, England's Craig Kieswetter won the award, while Sri Lanka's Kumar Sangakkara won it in 2014. In 2012 and 2016, West Indies' Marlon Samuels won the award. Australia's Mitchell Marsh bagged it in 2021.

187.title: Hyderabad student beaten by a group of boys in hostel over Prophet remark, video surfaces
187.article_body: Police have registered a case against a group of students of the ICFAI Business School in Hyderabad after a video of a student being assaulted surfaced. The victim said he was beaten because of a personal chat with a girl, wherein he allegedly insulted Prophet Muhammad. He said he was kicked in his testicles and was threatened to be killed.

188.title: Driver fails to escape vehicle as landslide hits in Kerala, washed away
188.article_body: A 45-year-old man who was allegedly driving a tempo traveller failed to escape from the vehicle as a landslide hit the Munnar-Vattavada road in Kerala's Idukki. He was washed away in the landslide, police said. "All other vehicles and passengers managed to escape but he is suspected to have been trapped inside the vehicle," police added.

189.title: Drones detected along India-Pak border doubled in 2022: BSF DG
189.article_body: The number of drone flights detected along the India-Pakistan international border has more than doubled this year, according to the BSF Director General (DG) Pankaj Kumar Singh. He said that of the total 266 drone flights detected, 215 drone flights were seen in Punjab this year. Singh was speaking at the inauguration of the BSF Drone Forensic Laboratory.

190.title: 5 BJP leaders threaten to contest as independents in Guj polls
190.article_body: At least five BJP leaders have threatened to contest as independents in the upcoming Gujarat Assembly elections after being denied tickets. They are Harshad Vasava, Madhu Shrivastav, Dinesh Patel, Satish Patel and Arvind Ladani. Vasava filed his nomination from Nandod as an independent on Friday. Meanwhile, state minister Harsh Sanghavi said, "BJP is like a family and all members...are united."

191.title: 'Twilight' actor Taylor Lautner marries girlfriend Taylor Dome; pics surface
191.article_body: 'The Twilight Saga' actor Taylor Lautner and his longtime girlfriend Taylor Dome got married at Epoch Estate Wines in US' California on Friday. Around 100 of their closest friends and family members attended their wedding. The couple reportedly began dating after meeting in 2018 and got engaged in November last year.

192.title: We knew we were better than them: Shadab on India-Pak T20 WC match
192.article_body: Pakistan all-rounder Shadab Khan, during an interview ahead of their 2022 T20 World Cup game against England, recalled their match against India during the group stage and said that though they lost that game, they knew they were the better side. "We knew if we give our 100 per cent, the result will come on our side," he added.

193.title: Feel good: Biden as Dems retain control of Senate in mid-term polls
193.article_body: After the Democrats retained control of the US Senate in mid-term elections, President Joe Biden said, "I know I'm coming in stronger...I feel good and I'm looking forward to the next couple of years." Democrats will now have 50 seats in the 100-member Senate with the Republicans currently on 49. Senator Catherine Cortez Masto won from Nevada.

194.title: What have been the highest and lowest totals scored in finals in T20 World Cup history?
194.article_body: Australia's 173/2 in T20 World Cup 2021 final against New Zealand is the highest total in a T20 World Cup final. It's followed by New Zealand's 172/4 in last year's final, which Australia successfully chased. Sri Lanka's 101 against West Indies in 2012 final is lowest total, while India's 130/4 against Sri Lanka in 2014 final is the second-lowest total.

195.title: Glenn Maxwell slips and falls during a birthday party, breaks his leg
195.article_body: Australia all-rounder Glenn Maxwell broke his leg during a birthday party in Melbourne. The 34-year-old cricketer and the person celebrating his 50th birthday were running in a backyard when both slipped and fell, with Maxwell's leg becoming trapped under the other person's. Maxwell underwent surgery on Sunday and has been ruled out of cricket for an extended period.

196.title: Not SRK but his bodyguard was stopped at airport over luxury watches: Mumbai Customs
196.article_body: Mumbai Customs clarified that officials stopped Shah Rukh Khan's bodyguard Ravi Singh at airport for violating customs rules and not the actor. "The bodyguard had two luxurious watches and four empty watch boxes. Apart from this, there was also an empty box of an iWatch Series 8 in his luggage," Mumbai Customs said. They had to pay ₹6.83-lakh custom duty.

197.title: I'm a legend because I've surpassed struggles in life: Mithun
197.article_body: Actor Mithun Chakraborty said that he's not legendary because of hit films, but he's a legend because he "surpassed all the pains and struggles" in his life. "I've fought a lot to prove myself in this (film) industry," he added. The actor mentioned that he doesn't want a biopic on himself because it'll "never inspire anyone" to achieve their dreams.

198.title: Took 11 yrs, but the wait was worth it: Bosco on directorial debut
198.article_body: Choreographer-turned-director Bosco Martis said that it took 11 years for him to make his directorial debut. Bosco, who directed the recently released film 'Rocket Gang', said the wait was "worth it". "I was tested but with every year, I grew and learnt something," he said, adding that dance will 'always be' an integral part of his storytelling.

199.title: Woman injured after leopard attacks her in Mumbai's Aarey colony
199.article_body: A 34-year-old woman was injured after a leopard attacked her in Mumbai's Aarey colony, police said on Saturday. The leopard had pounced on the woman, who was returning from her workplace, after she ran on seeing the animal and fell down, a police official said. This is the second such incident to take place in the area this month.

200.title: I voted for Tharoor but won't join BJP ever: Cong leader's reply to Assam CM
200.article_body: Following Assam CM's claim that 1,000 Congress leaders who supported Shashi Tharoor in INC polls will likely join the BJP soon, Congress leader Salman Soz stated that he will never join the BJP, even if it becomes the only party left. "I was one of the 1,072 delegates who voted for Tharoor...We lost, but internal party democracy won," Salman tweeted.

201.title: Campuses must become incubators for startups: Goyal to institutes
201.article_body: Union Minister Piyush Goyal in an interaction with the heads and senior faculty members of IIFT and NID, among others, said that every campus must become an incubator for startups and "must strive to nurture and develop innovation and entrepreneurship". He asked the institutions to introspect if their education is tailormade to cater to the needs of tomorrow.

202.title: Life hasn't given you tight slaps: Shweta to Navya in talk over women's issues
202.article_body: Shweta Bachchan said it is very easy for her daughter Navya Naveli Nanda, as a 24-year-old, to say one should "block out noise" while industries work on attacking women's self-esteem. "You are young...life hasn't given you...a few tight slaps," she told Navya. "There is too much economics behind women not feeling like they look like a million bucks," Shweta said.

203.title: 'Drunk' driver rams car on footpath in Pune; 2 people injured
203.article_body: At least two people were injured after a car driver rammed the vehicle on a footpath and dragged one of them for a few metres in Pune. "We've detained the car driver and found that he was under the influence of alcohol," a senior police inspector said. According to a complaint, the car driver lost control of the vehicle.

204.title: Shall hesitate to go to his funeral: Amitabh on director Rakesh Kumar
204.article_body: Actor Amitabh Bachchan said that he "shall hesitate to go to" filmmaker Rakesh Kumar's funeral, who passed away on November 10. "I shall not be able to bear the sight of an inert Rakesh," he said, adding that he left "an imprint that is hard to remove or forget". He called Rakesh "a most affable and kind hearted human".

205.title: TRS MP donates ₹1 cr to govt hospital in Hyd where he was born
205.article_body: TRS Rajya Sabha MP Santosh Kumar J on Friday donated ₹1 crore to a government hospital in Hyderabad where he was born. Telangana Health and Finance Minister Harish Rao Thanneeru said the funds will be used for the development of the maternity hospital in Petlaburj. "It is commendable that Santosh remembered the hospital where he was born," Rao added.

206.title: Bengaluru South School Leaders' Council holds first meet at BJP MP's office
206.article_body: The Bengaluru South School Leaders' Council held its first meeting on Saturday at the office of BJP MP Tejasvi Surya. Over 40 student leaders from around 25 schools attended the meeting and discussed the future action plan. The Council will also host a sports event for government school students in December. The Council is responsible for conducting quarterly events.

207.title: Australia to consider banning paying of ransoms to cyber criminals
207.article_body: Australia will consider making the paying of ransoms to cyber hackers illegal, Home Affairs Minister Clare O'Neil said. This comes after Australia's biggest health insurer, Medibank, was hit by a massive cyber attack last month. Singapore Telecommunications-owned telecom company Optus, along with at least eight other companies, have been breached since September.

208.title: UK influencer who had 18 surgeries to look like Korean woman says 'want to be man again’
208.article_body: A year after British-born influencer Oli London revealed he underwent 18 cosmetic surgeries to look like a Korean woman, he announced, "I'm no longer trans and have gone back to living as a man." London said that identifying as 'transracial' was a "big mistake", adding, "I just want to be a boy." He wanted to resemble BTS singer Park Jimin.

209.title: FTX ex-CEO denies flying to S America, says he's in Bahamas
209.article_body: Former CEO of bankrupt crypto exchange FTX Sam Bankman-Fried has denied rumors that he has flown to South America. He told Reuters he was in the Bahamas. Earlier, Flightradar24 tweeted that the former crypto billionaire was flying from Nassau to Argentina. Bankman-Fried stepped down as CEO of FTX the day it filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection in the US.

210.title: Remote employee not disclosing location costs US startup $30,000
210.article_body: US-based GravyWork CEO Alex Atwood told the WSJ that he received notices for not registering his business in Texas and California and was asked to pay $30,000 in taxes and fees. This happened after a former software engineer worked from those states for long periods without informing him. He said the estimated price GravyWork paid for the issue was $500,000.

211.title: People of north India should see us as victims, not killers: Rajiv Gandhi case convict
211.article_body: RP Ravichandran, one of the six convicts who was released on Saturday in the assassination case of former Prime Minister Rajiv Gandhi, said that the people of north India should see them as "victims instead of terrorists or killers". "Time and power determine who is a terrorist or a freedom fighter but time will judge us as innocent," he added.

212.title: Hundreds of activists protest at COP27 in Egypt, enter UN territory
212.article_body: Hundreds of environmental activists staged a demonstration at the ongoing UN climate summit in Egypt, known as COP27, and called on industrialised nations to pay for the impact of global warming. The protesters marched through the conference's 'Blue Zone' which is considered United Nations' territory. Subsequently, German officials raised concerns about surveillance and intimidation of delegates.

213.title: Family of brain dead 18-month-old girl donates her organs in Delhi
213.article_body: The family of an 18-month-old girl, Mahira, who was declared brain dead at Delhi's AIIMS, has donated her organs. A native of Haryana, Mahira fell from her house's balcony. Her liver was transplanted in a six-month-old child at the Institute of Liver and Biliary Sciences, while both her kidneys were transplanted successfully in a 17-year-old boy at AIIMS.

214.title: I am very sorry for them: Rajiv Gandhi assassination convict Nalini Sriharan to Gandhis
214.article_body: After her release from prison on Saturday, Nalini Sriharan, a convict in former PM Rajiv Gandhi's assassination case, said she felt "very sorry" when asked about her message for the Gandhis and families of those who were killed. "They have lost their dear ones. I hope they will come out of that tragedy once for all, any time," Nalini said.

215.title: Cong claims EVMs carried in private vehicles in Himachal's Rampur, urges ECI to take action
215.article_body: Congress has claimed that Electronic Voting Machines were carried in private vehicles in Rampur during the Himachal Pradesh Assembly elections. Calling it an "utterly unfortunate incident", Congress legal cell working chairman Pranay Pratap Singh asked the Chief Electoral Officer to "take cognisance in the said matter".  "The BJP party shall make a mockery out of elections," his complaint read.

216.title: Smuggler arrested in Noida with over 174 kg marijuana worth ₹50 lakh
216.article_body: The Gautam Buddha Nagar Police and UP Special Task Force arrested a man, Ajju, for allegedly smuggling over 174 kg of marijuana worth ₹50 lakh. "The suspect was carrying marijuana in his personal car, along with three other accomplices from Rajahmundry in Andhra Pradesh…The vehicle used by the suspect for smuggling the drug has also been seized," said Noida's ADCP.

217.title: Actor-filmmaker Rakesh Kumar passes away aged 81 after battling cancer
217.article_body: Veteran actor and filmmaker Rakesh Kumar passed away on November 10 in Mumbai after a long battle with cancer. He was known for his work in films like Khoon Pasina, Do Aur Do Paanch, Mr Natwarlal and Yaarana among other films. Amitabh Bachchan condoled his demise and wrote, "Another colleague has left us and me in particular."

218.title: Jaishankar meets his Ukrainian counterpart, discusses nuclear concerns
218.article_body: India's External Affairs Minister Dr S Jaishankar met his Ukrainian counterpart Dmytro Kuleba in Cambodia on the sidelines of the ASEAN-India summit on Saturday. "Our discussions covered recent developments in the conflict, the grain initiative and nuclear concerns," Jaishankar tweeted. "I met to discuss bilateral cooperation and ways to end Russia's war on Ukraine," Kuleba said about the meeting.

219.title: Bajrang Dal activist killed in crude bomb attack in Jharkhand
219.article_body: A Bajrang Dal activist was killed after crude bombs were hurled at him by men on motorcycles in Jharkhand's West Singhbhum on Saturday, police said. The activist was taken to hospital where doctors declared that he was brought dead. Hundreds of the deceased's supporters gathered following the incident and the CRPF was called to maintain law and order, police added.

220.title: NHRC holds Delhi, Haryana, Punjab & UP governments responsible for stubble burning
220.article_body: The National Human Rights Commission (NHRC) on Saturday held the Delhi, Haryana, Punjab and Uttar Pradesh governments responsible for the continued stubble burning. The commission said that it is of the opinion that farmers are burning stubble "under compulsion". It also asked the state and Union Territory governments to submit affidavits on points raised by it within four days.

221.title: 'Stree 2' might be the next film, says director Amar Kaushik
221.article_body: Director Amar Kaushik said that the sequel of 'Stree' "might be" his next directorial film. "I'm aware that people will compare the sequel to the first part...yes, we have got an idea and 'Stree 2' might be the next film," he stated. Kaushik, who is currently promoting 'Bhediya', called Varun Dhawan the "most curious", "most enthusiastic" and "most passionate" actor.

222.title: ICC shares rankings of Pakistan, England players ahead of T20 World Cup 2022 final
222.article_body: Ahead of Pakistan-England T20 World Cup 2022 final, the ICC shared rankings of Pakistan and England players. England have more batters in top 100, while Pakistan's Muhammad Rizwan and Babar Azam are ranked second and fourth, respectively. Both Pakistan and England have three bowlers each in top 25, while Moeen Ali is top-ranked T20I all-rounder among the two teams.

223.title: Who will win 2022 T20 World Cup final? I'm going with Pakistan: Aakash
223.article_body: Cricketer-turned-commentator Aakash Chopra has predicted Pakistan to win the 2022 T20 World Cup final against England on Sunday. "Who will win? I feel Pakistan will win...I don't think it will be a very high-scoring match," he said in a video posted on his YouTube channel. England reached the final after defeating India in the semi-final on Thursday.

224.title: What is the head-to-head record of Pakistan and England in T20I cricket?
224.article_body: England and Pakistan have played 28 matches against each other in T20Is. Pakistan have won nine times, while England have won 18 times including once in Super Over. One of their matches produced no result. Pakistan's highest total against England in 232/6 registered in 2021, while England's highest total against Pakistan is 221/3 recorded in September this year.

225.title: Man protests in Bengaluru after accident due to pothole, video surfaces
225.article_body: A video went viral on social media of a man seen protesting by sitting on the road in Bengaluru after falling from his scooter due to a pothole. He can be heard asking for a response from the BBMP officials. "Thanks to CV Raman Nagar MLA...for keeping Bengalurians [struggling] with their lives every day," read a Twitter post.

226.title: Flood alert for 5 Tamil Nadu districts, 4,230 cubic feet excess water discharged from dam
226.article_body: A flood alert has been issued for Theni, Dindigul, Madurai, Sivaganga and Ramanathapuram districts, news agency ANI reported. The dam officer said that 4,230 cubic feet of excess water has been discharged from Vaigai Dam in Theni. In October 2022, a flood alert was issued for 11 districts in the state.

227.title: Ganderbal DM bans use of electric heating appliances, later amends order
227.article_body: Amid the winter chill in J&K, the Ganderbal DM on Friday released an order banning the use of electric heating appliances. The order stated that the decision was taken to avoid unscheduled power cuts and provide a hassle-free electricity supply to consumers. After outrage, the order was amended to ban nichrome coil-based crude water heaters and crude cooking heaters.

228.title: We've got nothing to lose but everything to win: Akhtar on Pak-Eng T20 WC final
228.article_body: Ex-Pakistan fast bowler Shoaib Akhtar, in a video posted on his social media, said they've got nothing to lose but everything to win in the 2022 T20 World Cup final against England. "Pakistan were nowhere and now [in the final]...our team is looking like a solid unit...we [only] need to play our A game," he added.

229.title: Anupam Kher fails to get Uunchai ticket as shows run housefull, shares video
229.article_body: Actor Anupam Kher shared a video of himself trying to buy a ticket for his movie 'Uunchai'. In the video, the man at the ticket counter can be seen telling him that there is no ticket available as the shows of the film are running housefull. "For the first time, saw success in failure," he wrote.

230.title: Former AIIMS Delhi director Randeep Guleria takes voluntary retirement
230.article_body: Randeep Guleria, former director of All India Institute of Medical Sciences in Delhi, has taken voluntary retirement. Reports said Guleria served the institute for over 30 years. His five-and-a-half-year tenure as the director of the institute ended on September 23. He applied for Voluntary Retirement Scheme. Guleria had joined AIIMS as an assistant professor in Department of Medicine in 1992.

231.title: Donald Trump's daughter Tiffany marries businessman Michael Boulos; pics surface
231.article_body: Former US President Donald Trump and his ex-wife Marla Maple's daughter Tiffany Trump and Michael Boulos got married in Mar-a-Lago on Saturday. Trump escorted his 29-year-old daughter down the aisle before she exchanged vows with the 25-year-old businessman. Melania, Ivanka, Eric, Donald Trump Jr were also present at the wedding.

232.title: Don't want people to gamble: Amit on refusing sports app endorsement
232.article_body: Actor Amit Sadh recently refused to endorse a sports app as he didn't want to promote something "that falls into grey areas". He said that even though he has huge respect for the game, he doesn't want people to gamble. "I don't wish to promote such things knowing how bad it can get. I would personally feel responsible," he shared.

233.title: 2-yr-old girl falls into open water tank at building, dies in Pune
233.article_body: A two-year-old girl died after she fell into an open water tank at an under-construction building in Pune. Following this, police booked the builder and contractor over their alleged negligence. The girl's father, who works as a labourer at the under-construction building, claimed in a complaint that the accused hadn't taken proper measures like covering the tank with a lid.

234.title: Blasting work at Navi Mumbai airport causing cracks in homes: Villagers
234.article_body: Blasting activity taking place during the construction of the Navi Mumbai International Airport has caused cracks to develop in houses, residents of the Wahal village have claimed. The village is located near the boundary of the airport. Earlier this month, the village sarpanch even wrote a letter to the City and Industrial Development Corporation of Maharashtra Limited over the matter.

235.title: ₹10,000 fine for mishap due to pet dog, cat in Noida; owner to pay medical expenses
235.article_body: Noida Authority has announced a fine of ₹10,000 in case of any mishap that takes place due to a pet dog or a pet cat. Besides that, the authority has said that medical expenses of the injured person or animal will be borne by the owner of the pet. Sterilization and anti-rabies vaccination of pet dogs has been made mandatory.

236.title: Was disrespected for my skin colour, slept without food: Mithun
236.article_body: Actor Mithun Chakraborty shared that he was "disrespected for a lot of years" because of his skin colour. He remembered that there were days when he'd sleep with an empty stomach. "I used to cry myself to sleep," the actor said. Mithun added he doesn't want a biopic on him because his story will discourage people from achieving their dreams.

237.title: How much prize money will T20 World Cup 2022 winners, runners-up get today?
237.article_body: The winners of the T20 World Cup 2022 final between Pakistan and England today will get a prize money of $1.6 million. Meanwhile, the runners-up will receive $800,000. Apart from the prize money for the final match, the two teams will also get bonus for their Super 12 victories. They will be getting $40,000 per Super 12 stage match victory.

238.title: Twitter Blue will probably 'come back by end of next week,' says Musk
238.article_body: Responding to a Twitter user asking when Twitter Blue will return, Elon Musk replied, "Probably end of next week." On Friday, Twitter paused its recently announced  $8 blue tick subscription amid an increase in fake accounts. Twitter introduced the "Official" label last Wednesday but a few hours later, Musk tweeted that he had "killed" it.

239.title: Election workers in Himachal Pradesh trek for 15 km in deep snow for 6 hours
239.article_body: A video has gone viral on social media showing polling agents trekking in deep snow in Himachal Pradesh after the Assembly elections concluded on Saturday. The video shows polling parties returning from Chasak Batori polling station, situated at an altitude of 12,000 ft, in Bharmour  Assembly Constituency in Chamba district. They walked around 15 km in snow for 6 hours.

240.title: Iranian man who inspired 2004 film 'The Terminal' dies at Paris airport
240.article_body: Merhan Karimi Nasseri, an Iranian man who lived at Paris' Charles de Gaulle Airport from 1988 until 2006 and inspired the 2004 Steven Spielberg directorial 'The Terminal', passed away at the airport after suffering a heart attack on Saturday. He died at the Terminal 2F of the airport, where he had been living again in recent weeks.

241.title: Unmanned, solar-powered US space plane returns to Earth after 908 days, pic surfaces
241.article_body: An unmanned US military space plane returned to Earth on Saturday after spending 908 days in orbit, surpassing its previous record of 780 days. The solar-powered X-37B shuttle has now spent a total of more than 10 years in space and flown more than 1.3 billion miles during six missions, Boeing said in a statement.

242.title: Democrats retain control of US Senate in mid-term elections
242.article_body: President Joe Biden's Democrats retained control of the US Senate on Saturday in the mid-term elections, US media reports claimed. Democratic US Senator Catherine Cortez Masto has won re-election in Nevada, bringing the total number of seats under Democrats' control to 50. The results have defied predictions of Republican control over both the houses of US Congress.

243.title: Two planes collide mid-air and crash at US air show, video surfaces
243.article_body: Two World War II-era planes collided at an airshow causing a huge fireball explosion to shoot up into the air. It happened at the Commemorative Air Force's Wings Over Dallas Show in Dallas, Texas. Video of the incident shows the two show planes colliding head on with onlookers screaming in background. It wasn't immediately clear how many people were aboard.

244.title: 3 of a family killed in accident on Delhi-Lucknow highway
244.article_body: Three members of a family were killed after their speeding car rammed into another vehicle on the Delhi-Lucknow National Highway on Saturday evening, police said. The driver of the car reportedly died on the spot while two people, including a woman, were rushed to a government hospital where they were declared brought dead. The accident occurred in UP's Amroha district.

245.title: 5 Afghan nationals found dead at a home in Turkey's capital
245.article_body: Five Afghan nationals with stab wounds were found dead in Turkey's capital Ankara, Khaama Press reported citing Turkish media on Saturday. Afghan officials in Turkey confirmed the death of five Afghans in a house in an area where Afghan and Syrian refugees live. Authorities reportedly started looking for them after receiving missing person complaints from their families.

246.title: Vice President Dhankhar discusses bilateral ties with Cambodian PM
246.article_body: Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar met Cambodian Prime Minister Hun Sen in Phnom Penh on Saturday and discussed the enhancement of ties in de-mining, human resource and development projects. The leaders witnessed the exchange of four agreements between the two countries in streams of health, culture and wildlife. Dhankhar commended Sen for his country's successful chairmanship of the ASEAN Summit.

247.title: 21 killed as bus falls into canal in Egypt’s Nile Delta
247.article_body: At least 21 people were killed, including three children, after a bus fell into a canal in the Nile River Delta region of Egypt on Saturday. The accident occurred in Dakahlia province, around 100 km northeast of the capital of Cairo. A senior provincial police official said the bus driver seemed to have lost control of the steering wheel.

248.title: Things Cristiano has done this season are not acceptable: Rooney
248.article_body: Former Manchester United forward Wayne Rooney has criticised Cristiano Ronaldo and asked him to keep his "head down" and "be ready to play when the manager needs you". "If he does that, he will be an asset. If he doesn't, it will become an unwanted distraction," said Rooney. He added that "things" Cristiano has done this season are "not acceptable".

249.title: India's current golden chess generation will only get better: Anand
249.article_body: Indian chess grandmaster Viswanathan Anand said the country currently has a golden generation that will only get stronger as time progresses. "There is a wave...The internet has made chess more accessible to everyone," said Anand. He also named the teen trio of R Praggnanandhaa, Arjun Erigaisi and D Gukesh while talking about the next generation of Indian chess stars.

250.title: Terrorists shoot 2 labourers from Uttar Pradesh in J&K, 1 critical
250.article_body: Two residents of Uttar Pradesh, both of whom are labourers, were shot at by terrorists in Jammu and Kashmir's Anantnag on Saturday. The victims have been identified as Chota Prasad, a resident of Gorakhpur, and Govind, a resident of Kushinagar. Both of them were shifted to a hospital for treatment. One of them is in a critical condition.

251.title: Journalist asks Babar Azam question on IPL, he looks at Pakistan media manager
251.article_body: During the press conference ahead of T20 World Cup 2022 final between England and Pakistan, a journalist asked Babar Azam a question on IPL. Following the question, Babar looked at his media manager, refusing to answer the question. The media manager then responded, "We are taking questions on the World Cup final at the moment."

252.title: Rohit Sharma looked depressed during T20 World Cup: Shoaib Akhtar
252.article_body: Former Pakistan pacer Shoaib Akhtar said that Indian skipper Rohit Sharma looked "depressed" and "off" during the T20 World Cup in Australia. "We all knew that Rohit wanted to be the skipper. But this is not an easy task to do. You have to live and breathe captaincy and also have to sacrifice family life," Akhtar said.

253.title: Under Matthew Hayden's guidance, Pak are a better unit: Brett Lee
253.article_body: Ex-Australian pacer Brett Lee said that under the guidance of his former teammate and Pakistan team's mentor, Matthew Hayden, the Babar Azam-led side is a better unit. "He's (Hayden) always been a leader. He's always been a person that speaks from the heart and a person that will call it out if it's not right...There's so much transparency," Lee said.

254.title: Nirmala Sitharaman should focus on economy, not Baramati: NCP
254.article_body: NCP commented on Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman amid reports of her planning to visit Baramati, which is represented by NCP leader Supriya Sule in the Lok Sabha, again. "Sitharaman is concentrating so much on 'B for Baramati' that she has forgotten 'E for [the] economy'," NCP spokesperson Clyde Crasto said. Notably, Sitharaman visited Baramati for three days in September 2022.

255.title: High command will soon decide on Raj leadership: Congress leader
255.article_body: Congress leader Acharya Pramod Krishnam said the party's high command would "very soon" take a decision on the leadership of Rajasthan. "The political scenario in Rajasthan is in the notice of the party high command," said Krishnam, adding that each and every MLA should abide by the high command's decision. Krishnam is reportedly close to former Deputy CM Sachin Pilot.

256.title: SC issues notice to govt over delay in appointment of judges
256.article_body: The Supreme Court (SC) has issued a notice to the Ministry of Law and Justice and sought its response over the delay in appointing judges. The court noted 10 recommendations were pending for appointing a High Court judge. "Unless the bench is adorned by competent lawyers, the very concept of the Rule of Law and Justice suffers," the court said.

257.title: India announces additional $5 mn for ASEAN-India science fund
257.article_body: Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar on Saturday said India will make an additional contribution of $5 million to the ASEAN-India science and technology fund. The additional funding is expected to enhance cooperation in the sectors of renewable energy, public health and smart agriculture. The ASEAN-India Science and Technology Collaboration was formally launched in 1996.

258.title: Protesters clash with police in Bolivia; demand fresh census
258.article_body: Protesters clashed with police in Santa Cruz, Bolivia, on Friday amidst a general strike and weeks of unrest. The protesters demanded a fresh census be conducted to reflect the region's increased population and get increased funding from the government. Protesters clashed using molotov cocktails, stones and sticks. Images surfaced of a farmers' union bank being looted and being set ablaze.

259.title: FTA deal has had a flat tyre since I left office, let's get it done: Ex-UK PM Johnson
259.article_body: Former UK Prime Minister Boris Johnson called for finalising the free trade agreement (FTA) between India and UK which was targeted to be done by Diwali this year. "Let's finally deliver that free trade agreement which mysteriously seems to have developed a flat tyre since I left office," Johnson said. "I wonder what the hold-up is," he added.

260.title: Can't guarantee that I'll play another World Cup: Brazil's Neymar
260.article_body: Brazil forward Neymar said that the 2022 Qatar World Cup could be his last and he will "play it" like his last tournament. "I can't guarantee that I'll play another (World) Cup. I honestly don't know," said Neymar. The 30-year-old also said there would be a new coach for Brazil and he doesn't know if "that coach will like" him.

261.title: Actor Pawan Kalyan booked by police for sitting on roof of speeding car in Andhra
261.article_body: A case of rash driving was registered against Pawan Kalyan for a stunt, where he was seen sitting on the roof of a speeding car during his visit to a village in Andhra Pradesh. It was registered following a complaint by a motorist. The motorist apparently fell from his bike because of the driving of Pawan Kalyan's convoy of vehicles.

262.title: Blessings needed for fruitful results: Kejriwal on gods on notes appeal
262.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Saturday said he had appealed to add the pictures of deities Lakshmi and Ganesh on currency notes as god's blessings are needed to reap fruitful results. He opined that people would receive blessings if notes carry pictures of gods. "Everything boils to Karma but results will be fruitful when Lord's blessings are there," he added.

263.title: Brentford's Toney scores 98th min goal to secure 2-1 win over Man City
263.article_body: Brentford striker Ivan Toney scored twice as his side won 2-1 against defending champions Manchester City in their final Premier League game before the World Cup break. "Obviously (being left out of the England squad was), a disappointment but...I'll just keep going," said Toney. After the match was tied 1-1, Toney scored in the 98th minute to secure victory.

264.title: Elon Musk to join G20 summit in Indonesia virtually: Report
264.article_body: World's richest person Elon Musk will join the G20 summit in Indonesia's Bali virtually rather than in person, CNBC Indonesia reported. "He is unable to attend because...there are incidents in US and he must be present there," an official from the Indonesian Chamber of Commerce was quoted as saying. Musk is due to speak at a business-related event.

265.title: Punjab witnesses 2,467 stubble-burning incidents in a day
265.article_body: Punjab recorded 2,467 stubble-burning incidents on Saturday with Bathinda registering 358 farm fires, the maximum. With Saturday's cases, Punjab's tally of farm fires recorded between September 15 and November 12 rose to 43,144, as per the Punjab Remote Sensing Centre. Data suggests there has been a 27% drop in stubble-burning cases as compared to the corresponding period of last year.

266.title: Giriraj Sena chief Kamal Giri Dev assassinated in Jharkhand
266.article_body: Hindu organisation Giriraj Sena's chief Kamal Giri Dev was assassinated in Jharkhand's West Singhbhum district on Saturday. As per reports, Dev was standing with his friend at a chowk when three people approached him and attacked him with a bottle bomb. Thereafter, the attackers escaped from the spot. Dev was rushed to a nearby hospital, however, doctors declared him dead.

267.title: Pic of MS Dhoni with Amit Shah goes viral, people react
267.article_body: A picture of MS Dhoni meeting Home Minister Amit Shah has gone viral. The duo met at an event in Chennai, marking the 75th anniversary of India Cements. Tamil Nadu Governor RN Ravi also joined Dhoni and Shah at the event. "What's next? Dhoni joining BJP?" a fan wrote. "Chanakya of politics meets Chanakya of cricket," wrote another.

268.title: These 32 years were like hell: Rajiv Gandhi killing convict Nalini after release
268.article_body: One of the convicts of the Rajiv Gandhi assassination case, Nalini Sriharan, who was released from jail on Saturday, said, "It was a hellish experience in prison during these 32 years." She added, "My conviction that I am innocent has kept me alive all these years. Otherwise, I would've ended my life." She said she was 'framed' in the killing.

269.title: 1000 Congress leaders who voted for Tharoor will join BJP: Assam CM
269.article_body: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma said he is expecting the 1,000 Congress delegates who voted for Shashi Tharoor as party President to join the BJP. "Result was known and declared even before counting of votes," said Sarma, adding that the delegates were the "only democratic people" in Congress. Mallikarjun Kharge was elected as Congress chief after polling nearly 8,000 votes.

270.title: Samantha Ruth Prabhu works out in gym with cannula in one arm, shares video
270.article_body: Samantha Ruth Prabhu shared a video in which she can be seen doing arm exercise with one hand while a cannula can be seen in her other arm. She also shared a picture with her fitness trainer. "Last few months you've been among the few people who has seen it all...through the weakness, through...tears, through...high dose steroid therapies," Samantha wrote.

271.title: Having a Canadian passport doesn't mean I'm any less of an Indian: Akshay Kumar
271.article_body: Actor Akshay Kumar on Saturday said that his Canadian passport did not make him "any less of an Indian", adding, "I am very much Indian." He said this while responding to a query on the criticism over his Canadian citizenship. Kumar said he has remained in India despite getting the Canadian passport nine years ago.

272.title: Daughter of Naroda Patiya massacre convict gets BJP ticket in Guj
272.article_body: The BJP has given a ticket to the daughter of a 2002 Naroda Patiya massacre case convict for the upcoming Gujarat Assembly elections. Manoj Kukrani's daughter, 30-year-old Payal Kukrani, is an anaesthetist and has been fielded from Naroda in Ahmedabad. She's among the youngest candidates fielded by the BJP in Gujarat this time. Manoj was earlier sentenced to life imprisonment.

273.title: Scarlett to return as Black Widow in 'Avengers: Secret Wars': Reports
273.article_body: Scarlett Johansson is reportedly returning to the Marvel Cinematic Universe. According to reports, the actress will reprise her role as Natasha Romanoff aka Black Widow in 'Avengers: Secret Wars', an upcoming film which is expected to release in 2026. The film will reportedly also feature Chris Hemsworth and Benedict Cumberbatch among others in pivotal roles.

274.title: Unfortunate & condemnable: Nitish on WB minister's comment on Prez Murmu
274.article_body: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar on Saturday criticised West Bengal minister Akhil Giri for his comments on President Droupadi Murmu, calling it "unfortunate and condemnable". "How can anyone make such comments on the President of India?" Kumar said, adding no one has the right to make such remarks. In a video, Akhil Giri was heard saying, "How does our President look?"

275.title: Eng beating Ind in T20 WC semifinal was spectacular: Ex-cricketer
275.article_body: After England defeated India by 10 wickets in the T20 World Cup semifinal on Thursday, ex-cricketer Kevin Pietersen said that the English team's "performance ranks right up there". "It was convincing as anything because that Indian team is star-studded. To beat them as convincingly as they did was spectacular. They didn't let India into the game at all," Pietersen said.

276.title: Rahul Gandhi may miss Parliament's winter session: Congress
276.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi is expected to miss the Parliament's upcoming winter session because of the ongoing Bharat Jodo Yatra, the party said on Saturday. The winter session is likely to start in December's first week and will conclude by the month's end. Other Congress leaders KC Venugopal and Digvijaya Singh are also expected to miss the session.

277.title: Farmers should get fertilisers easily, no shortage in state: MP CM
277.article_body: Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan on Friday said that farmers of the state should get fertilisers easily. If the distribution system is lacking, it should be fixed, he said, adding that there's  no shortage of fertilisers in the state. His comment came after he held discussions with the collectors of districts facing problems with the distribution of fertilisers.

278.title: 147-member Pak delegation visits Hazrat Nizamuddin Dargah in Delhi
278.article_body: A 147-member religious delegation from Pakistan on Saturday visited the Hazrat Nizamuddin Aulia Dargah in New Delhi and offered a "chaddar" at the Sufi shrine, the Pakistani High Commission in India said in a tweet. The delegation, led by an official from Pakistan's Ministry of Religious Affairs and Interfaith Harmony, arrived in New Delhi from Islamabad on November 7.

279.title: I'm not stealing from anyone: Akshay on being trolled for doing too many films
279.article_body: Akshay Kumar, reacting to being trolled for doing 'too many films' in a year, said, "Who questions someone for working a lot?" "I do four films a year...I do ads...I work, but I'm not stealing from anyone," he said, adding, "I'll work, who won't if they've...chance to...work? I'll do four films...I'll give 50 days if required and...90 days if needed."

280.title: Ananya Panday shares childhood pic with Aryan Khan on his 25th b'day
280.article_body: Actress Ananya Panday took to her Instagram Stories on Saturday to wish Shah Rukh Khan's son Aryan Khan on his 25th birthday. She shared an unseen picture of them together from their childhood, and wrote, "Missing baby Aryan. Happy birthday to my first and forever best friend." Aryan's sister Suhana Khan also wished him on his birthday.

281.title: Shah urges TN govt to impart technical, medical education in Tamil
281.article_body: Union Minister Amit Shah on Saturday urged the Tamil Nadu government to impart technical and medical education in Tamil, saying it would be "a great service to the promotion of the language". He further said the move would help students understand lessons better. Students in several states are already reaping benefits from receiving higher education in regional languages, he added.

282.title: Ambedkar would be horrified by today's caste entrenchment: Tharoor
282.article_body: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor said there is greater consciousness of caste in Indian society today compared to the 1950s. "Ambedkar wanted to completely destroy the caste system and he [would] probably be horrified to realize that...(it) is more and more entrenched," said Tharoor. He added that parties against discrimination or untouchability nonetheless seek votes in the name of caste.

283.title: Mysuru to get 100-foot-tall statue of Tipu Sultan: Congress MLA
283.article_body: Karnataka Congress MLA Tanveer Sait said a 100-foot-tall statue of Tipu Sultan would be erected in Mysuru's Srirangapatna. "The BJP government has been distorting the history around Tipu Sultan," said Sait, adding that the statue will represent "actual history". Former CM Siddaramaiah backed the announcement and asked why a statue can't be built for the 18th-century warrior.

284.title: NCP leader Awhad gets bail in case for disrupting film screening
284.article_body: A local court in Thane on Saturday granted bail to Nationalist Congress Party leader Jitendra Awhad and 11 others in a case that alleges they disrupted the screening of the Marathi film 'Har Har Mahadev'. The former state minister and his supporters were arrested on Friday for disrupting the movie's screening at a mall in Thane city on November 7.

285.title: Aurobindo Pharma's Q2 net profit drops 41% to ₹409 cr
285.article_body: Aurobindo Pharma reported a 41% year-over-year decline in its consolidated net profit at ₹409 crore for the second quarter ended September. The drug firm's revenue also declined to ₹5,739 crore as against ₹5,942 crore in the year-ago period. Earlier on Thursday, the Enforcement Directorate arrested Aurobindo's Director Sarath Reddy for alleged involvement in the Delhi liquor policy scam.

286.title: 3 Bihar men held for making fake Patanjali websites, cheating people
286.article_body: Three people were arrested from Bihar for posing as representatives of Patanjali Yog Gram in Uttarakhand's Haridwar and cheating people seeking Ayurvedic treatment, police said on Saturday. Twenty fake websites that resembled the official Patanjali website were identified and their details were sent to the National Internet Exchange of India to get them blocked, according to police.

287.title: World's highest polling station sees 100% turnout: Himachal officer
287.article_body: Himachal Pradesh Chief Electoral Officer Mahesh Pathania said Tashigang, the world's highest polling station, saw 100% voter turnout on Saturday for state Assembly elections. This came despite temperature reaching minus 10°C in the area. Stalls with traditional food were installed at the booth. Situated at a height of 15,256 feet in Lahaul and Spiti district, Tashigang has 52 registered voters.

288.title: It will come very soon: Akshay Kumar on the status of his Indian passport
288.article_body: Akshay Kumar, while speaking at Hindustan Times Leadership Summit, shared an update regarding the status of his Indian passport. "Yes, I had said it in 2019, I applied for it. But then...pandemic happened...everything shut down for 2.5 years...Very soon my passport will come," he stated. Akshay added having a Canadian passport doesn't mean he's any less of an Indian.

289.title: I get 2-3 kgs 'gaali' daily, convert it into nutrition: PM in T'gana
289.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi, while addressing BJP workers at the Begumpet Airport in Hyderabad on Saturday, said, "I get 2-3 kg of 'gaali' (abuse) every day...All such abuses in my stomach get converted into nutrition." "They (Opposition) have exhausted their dictionary of abuse...They do it because they have nothing else to offer," PM Modi added.

290.title: Farmer's house robbed at gunpoint in Nashik, valuables worth ₹8.50 lakh stolen
290.article_body: A group of five to six unidentified men allegedly entered a farmer's house and robbed his family at gunpoint in Maharashtra's Nashik district, police said on Saturday. The incident reportedly took place on the intervening night of Friday and Saturday. The accused escaped with 280 gm gold, 480 gm silver ornaments and cash, all worth ₹8.50 lakh, police added.

291.title: What will happen if T20 World Cup 2022 final gets washed out due to rain tomorrow?
291.article_body: Pakistan-England T20 World Cup 2022 final will take place on Sunday. There must be at least 10 overs bowled to side batting second (unless result is achieved sooner) for an official result. If rain doesn't allow the match to be completed on Sunday, it'll continue on Monday. Pakistan and England will be declared joint-winners if rain washes out reserve day.

292.title: Let's accept that we did not put up a good total: Sachin on India losing T20 WC 2022 semi
292.article_body: Referring to India's T20 World Cup 2022 semi-final defeat against England, Sachin Tendulkar said, "I know that the semi-final was really disappointing." Talking about India's total of 168, Sachin said, "Let's accept that we did not put up a good total on the board." He added India should have made around 190 given the dimensions of Adelaide.

293.title: Ukrainian police officers, broadcast services return to Kherson
293.article_body: Ukrainian police officers on Saturday returned to duty in Kherson following the withdrawal of Russian forces from the city, Ukraine's national police chief confirmed. Ukrainian TV and radio services have also reportedly resumed in the formerly Russian-occupied city. The Ukrainian military said it was overseeing "stabilization measures" in surrounding areas to make sure the city was safe.

294.title: Ranveer, Alia's 'Rocky Aur Rani Ki Prem Kahani' to release in April 2023
294.article_body: Filmmaker Karan Johar on Saturday announced the release date of his upcoming directorial 'Rocky Aur Rani Ki Prem Kahani', a film which stars Ranveer Singh and Alia Bhatt in the lead roles. The film will arrive in theatres on April 28, 2023. 'Rocky Aur Rani Ki Prem Kahani' will also feature Jaya Bachchan, Shabana Azmi and Dharmendra.

295.title: SC verdict to release Rajiv Gandhi case convicts has hurt sentiments: Baghel
295.article_body: Chhattisgarh CM and Congress leader Bhupesh Baghel said that the release of six convicts by the Supreme Court in the former PM Rajiv Gandhi assassination case has hurt the sentiments of crores of people. "Congress national spokesperson Jairam Ramesh also gave a statement...it should not have happened," Baghel said. "The convicts were released before time," Baghel added.

296.title: Australian gets 129-yr jail term for raping kids including 18-month-old in Philippines
296.article_body: A man known as 'Australia's worst pedophile' has been sentenced to 129 years in jail in the Philippines for rape and sexual abuse of children including an 18-month-old baby. This was the second conviction of Peter Gerard Scully, who is already serving a life sentence for numerous offences including child pornography. Scully held and abused eight children in the Philippines.

297.title: Set up dengue hospital in each UP district: CM Yogi to officials
297.article_body: CM Yogi Adityanath held a high-level meeting to review the dengue situation in Uttar Pradesh and asked officials to set up a dedicated hospital in every district. He also directed all ministers to be on the field and said every patient should be given proper treatment. On Friday, the Allahabad HC pulled up the state government for the dengue menace.

298.title: Shweta Bachchan says her children make fun of her menopause
298.article_body: Shweta Bachchan opened up about going through menopause and said her children, Navya and Agastya Nanda, make jokes about it. "If I'm in...bad mood, and I shout at them, they'll say, 'Mom is menopausing today.' That's not fair...For you, it's a joke, but think about it for me, everything is going south," Shweta said in an episode of Navya's podcast.

299.title: Forex reserve is not a showpiece, but to use on rainy day: RBI Guv
299.article_body: RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das said that foreign exchange reserves have to be used to ensure there is no undue exchange rate volatility. "We didn't pick the reserves just to keep it as a showpiece. We picked it only for this rainy day," he added. "There were some observations made that RBI is using reserves indiscriminately. It's not so," Das said.

300.title: Will hire best lawyers to get Article 370 & 35A restored: Bukhari
300.article_body: J&K Apni Party President Altaf Bukhari said the organisation will hire the country's best lawyers to approach the Supreme Court for the restoration of Articles 370 and 35A. "Our state, as it existed on August 5, 2019, should be restored," said Bukhari. He added that his party will collect details of youths in J&K jails and seek their release.

301.title: Sexual assault cases to be reviewed within 1 month: Uttarakhand CM
301.article_body: Uttarakhand CM Pushkar Singh Dhami on Saturday stated that complaints of sexual assault and domestic violence against women in the state would be examined within one month. He claimed action will be taken against government officials who don't work on such issues. Further, he launched a self-registration option on Uttarakhand Police App for women working in government and non-government offices.

302.title: Delhivery's Q2 revenue rises 20% YoY to ₹1,796 cr, net loss narrows 60%
302.article_body: Logistics company Delhivery's consolidated revenue in July-September quarter grew around 20% year-over-year to ₹1,796 crore as against ₹1,497.7 crore from the year-ago period. Delhivery's net loss in the second quarter narrowed 60% to ₹254.1 crore against the loss of ₹635 crore reported in the same period last year. The revenue from express parcel services grew 17% year-over-year to ₹1,125 crore.

303.title: Ex-guard at UK's Berlin embassy pleads guilty to spying for Russia
303.article_body: A former security guard at the British embassy in Berlin has pleaded guilty to spying for Russia and faces a maximum prison sentence of 14 years. David Ballantyne Smith provided confidential information about British civil servants to Russia's military attache in Berlin, British prosecutors said. They claim Smith was angry over the embassy's show of support for the LGBTQ+ community.

304.title: Himachal records 65.92% voter turnout till 5 pm: Election Commission
304.article_body: Himachal Pradesh recorded a voter turnout of 65.92% till 5 pm on Saturday, according to the Election Commission of India. Shillai recorded the highest turnout at 77%, while Sarkaghat recorded the lowest 55.40% among the 68 Assembly constituencies in the state, the poll panel added. "Elections were peaceful in all the segments," state Office of CEO's Joint Director Media said.

305.title: List of most polluted Indian cities today released
305.article_body: The Central Pollution Control Board released the city-wise air quality index (AQI) on Saturday, with Bihar's Motihari, Siwan and Darbhanga having the highest AQI at 419, 417 and 404, respectively. This is followed by Bettiah (394), Katihar (385), Purnia (379), Saharsa (372), Begusarai (370), Chhapra (368), Samastipur (348), Bhagalpur (325), Araria (316) and Bihar Sharif (314).

306.title: Buttler, Babar pose with T20 WC 2022 trophy on roof of MCG, ICC shares pics
306.article_body: England captain Jos Buttler and Pakistan captain Babar Azam posed with T20 World Cup 2022 trophy on roof of the Melbourne Cricket Ground (MCG) ahead of the final. The ICC shared pictures on Instagram, writing, "Pakistan and England have scaled the heights to reach the final...Who will come out on top at the MCG?" The final will take place tomorrow.

307.title: Jos Buttler, Babar Azam pick their Player of T20 World Cup 2022
307.article_body: England captain Jos Buttler and Pakistan captain Babar Azam, whose teams will face each other in T20 World Cup 2022 final, have picked their Player of the Tournament. Buttler chose Suryakumar Yadav, saying, "He's been incredibly eye-catching to watch in such a star-studded line-up. To stand out the way he has is amazing." Meanwhile, Babar chose his compatriot Shadab Khan.

308.title: Pay attention to PM Modi's empty promises made during Hyd speech: TRS MLC
308.article_body: TRS MLC K Kavitha urged the people of the state to pay attention to the empty promises made by PM Narendra Modi during his speech in Hyderabad on Saturday. She claimed that PM Modi had once again failed to explain the role the BJP-led Centre had played in Telangana's development. "People need to be aware of...BJP's dishonest strategies," she added.

309.title: Akshay confirms his exit from Hera Pheri 3, says 'Wasn't satisfied with script'
309.article_body: Akshay Kumar has confirmed that he's not a part of 'Hera Pheri 3'. "I wasn't satisfied with the script. I have to do what people want to see. That is why I backed out," he said. Paresh Rawal recently confirmed that Kartik Aaryan has been roped in for the third instalment. Reportedly, Kartik will play the role of Raju now.

310.title: BJP govt delaying J&K Assembly polls to continue proxy rule: AAP leader
310.article_body: AAP leader Harsh Dev Singh on Saturday claimed that BJP-led government was delaying the Assembly elections in Jammu and Kashmir to deny people their democratic rights and to continue its proxy rule. The silence of the Centre and Election Commission on Jammu and Kashmir while announcing elections for Himachal Pradesh and Gujarat amply revealed the government's intention, Singh said.

311.title: Will provide 500 units of free electricity if elected: J&K Apni Party
311.article_body: Jammu and Kashmir Apni Party President Altaf Bukhari on Saturday said his party will give 500 units of free electricity in Jammu in summer and Kashmir in winter if elected to power. Addressing a public rally at Sher-i-Kashmir Cricket Stadium in Srinagar, Bukhari said, "The day Apni Party will form its government, we'll provide employment to youth of Kashmir."

312.title: US seeks 15 years in prison for Theranos Founder Elizabeth Holmes
312.article_body: US Department of Justice recommended Theranos Founder Elizabeth Holmes should spend 15 years in prison and pay $800 million. Holmes was found guilty on four counts of wire fraud and conspiracy related to her now-defunct blood-testing startup. She faces up to 20 years in prison for each count. Earlier, Holmes urged a California judge to not send her to prison.

313.title: 4 dead bodies found in German town; murder-suicide suspected
313.article_body: Four dead bodies were recovered from three separate locations in Germany's Weilheim town on Friday, including the body of a 59-year-old man who is believed to have killed the other three individuals, according to police. Police found the bodies of two of the victims while searching the man's house. Investigators believe the suspect inflicted fatal injuries on himself, police informed.

314.title: Tremors felt across Delhi, other areas as 5.4 magnitude quake hits Nepal; 2nd in a week
314.article_body: Tremors were felt across Delhi and its neighbouring areas on Saturday as a 5.4 magnitude earthquake hit Nepal. This is the second time that tremors have been felt this week. Previously, strong tremors were felt in Delhi-NCR and several other parts of North India on Wednesday as a 6.3-magnitude earthquake had hit Nepal at around 2 am.

315.title: Vehicle carrying 25 tourists overturns due to landslide in Kerala
315.article_body: A tempo traveller carrying 25 tourists overturned after getting trapped under mud and debris due to a landslide in Kerala's Kundala following heavy rainfall. One person, believed to be the tempo's driver, is suspected to be trapped under debris. The incident reportedly took place after the vehicle lost control when water gushed towards it from one side of the road.

316.title: AAP releases 15th list of candidates for Gujarat Assembly elections
316.article_body: The Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) on Saturday released its 15th list of three candidates for the upcoming Gujarat Assembly elections. The party has fielded Mahendra Rajput from the Sidhpur constituency and Lalji Parmar from the Matar constituency. Mahendra Patil has been fielded from Udhana. The Arvind Kejriwal-led party will contest in the elections from all 182 seats in the state.

317.title: Who is 13-year-old singer Janaki who'll perform during T20 World Cup final tomorrow?
317.article_body: Indian-origin singer Janaki Easwar will perform along with the Australian rock band Icehouse during the T20 World Cup final at Melbourne Cricket Ground on Sunday. The 13-year-old rose to fame last year by becoming the youngest-ever contestant of the reality show 'The Voice Australia'. Her parents hail from Kozhikode in Kerala and have been in Australia for 15 years.

318.title: Republican control of US Senate will help Turkey's F-16 buy: Erdogan
318.article_body: Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan on Saturday said Turkey's efforts to complete its purchase of F-16 fighter jets would become "much easier" if Republicans ended up controlling the US Senate, Turkish media reported. Meanwhile, Democrat Senator Mark Kelly's re-election from the US state of Arizona has left Democrats one seat away from securing control of the Senate after Tuesday's elections.

319.title: Teaching job aspirant claims Kolkata policewoman bit her, probe on
319.article_body: Two days after a teaching job aspirant claimed she was bitten on one hand by a woman police officer, Kolkata Police on Friday ordered an inquiry into the allegation. Police said the victim was part of a demonstration in Camac Street on Wednesday seeking appointment in schools. She was arrested during the protest and released on bail the next day.

320.title: I’m predicting a comfortable win for Eng in T20 WC final: Kevin
320.article_body: Former English batter Kevin Pietersen said that he is predicting a comfortable win for England against Pakistan in the T20 World Cup final on Sunday. "One thing that can happen to this England team [is] they can get rolled over for none...That's what Pakistan need to hope for, because I don't think they can derail England themselves," Pietersen said.

321.title: Hinduja family reach 'confidential' agreement in UK court proceedings
321.article_body: UK-based Hinduja brothers, who were locked in a legal dispute in UK courts over their billionaire family assets, reached a "confidential" agreement, according to a Court of Appeal ruling in London on Friday. The case is related to the family's maxim "everything belongs to everyone and nothing belongs to anyone" and has been through protracted legal proceedings since November 2019.

322.title: Indian team needs a new breed of players: Former India pacer
322.article_body: Former Indian pacer Atul Wassan commented after India lost to England by 10 wickets in the semifinal match of the T20 World Cup on Thursday. "This game has proved again and again that you need a new breed. In 2007, we hardly had stars...and won the title. We are relying too much on our bigger names to deliver," Wassan said.

323.title: Bengaluru to receive light rainfall till November 15: IMD
323.article_body: After receiving 0.7 mm of rainfall on Saturday morning, the India Meteorological Department (IMD) said Bengaluru will witness light rainfall till November 15. The met department also announced a yellow alert for the coastal region of Karnataka, including Dakshina Kannada and Udupi, and south interior Karnataka till November 13. Notably, since October 1, Bengaluru has received 347 mm of rainfall.

324.title: It was a nightmare: Elizabeth Hurley recalls working with Matthew Perry
324.article_body: British actress-model Elizabeth Hurley recalled working with Matthew Perry in 'Serving Sara' while the 'Friends' actor battled substance abuse and underwent rehab. "It was a nightmare working with him at that time and, as it's...known, our movie was shut down because of his addiction," she said. Elizabeth added while "that was a little tough", when Matthew returned "he was fabulous".

325.title: My son is not interested in movies, wants to do fashion designing: Akshay
325.article_body: Akshay Kumar has revealed that his son Aarav has no interest in movies. He added, "I want to show [him] films, I want to tell him about films, he doesn't want to see films." "I want to put him into all that but he just doesn't want to see anything...He wants to study or do his fashion designing," said Akshay.

326.title: Why didn't we hire AB de Villiers for T20 WC as mentor: Ex-player
326.article_body: Former cricketer Atul Wassan asked why ex-South African batter AB de Villiers was not hired as a mentor for the Indian team during the T20 World Cup. "We can't have the same coaching staff for the T20 and Test cricket...[De Villiers] could have guided the team better. He can tell the players a bit about manufacturing the shots," Wassan said.

327.title: Delhi HC issues bailable warrants against Yamuna floodplain residents
327.article_body: The Delhi High Court (HC) has issued bailable warrants against the residents of Moolchand basti in Yamuna floodplains, Rajghat, for failing to comply with its earlier directives. "All the petitioners are residing on...Yamuna floodplains...in respect of which various injunctions stand issued by competent authorities and mandate the removal of all encroachments," the court said.

328.title: Nearly 4,000 people fined for violating emission rules in Delhi
328.article_body: Delhi Traffic Police has fined nearly 4,000 people from Tuesday to Friday this week for using diesel BS-IV or petrol BS-III vehicles, which have been banned till November 13 to check air pollution. The ban is part of the Graded Response Action Plan, Stage 3, imposed by the Commission for Air Quality Management. Fines up to ₹20,000 were imposed.

329.title: CBI books Mumbai private firm for cheating banks of ₹464 crore
329.article_body: A Mumbai-based company and its directors have been booked by the CBI for allegedly causing a loss of ₹464.41 crore to a nine-bank consortium led by SBI. The company is accused of disproportionately increasing its debtors and inventory to then write off the debts. The company, located in Prabhadevi, is engaged in the printing and trading of paper.

330.title: 2 arrested for attempted murder during Ganpati immersion in Pune
330.article_body: Pune City Police arrested two persons for allegedly attempting to murder a man two months ago during the Ganpati immersion procession. Police said the accused Siddharth Kamble (22) and Adnan Bagwan (21) had attacked the complainant with a sharp object on September 10 in Bhavani Peth. The attack is reported to have been motivated by a past dispute.

331.title: It is the best in the world: Zerodha CEO on Bengaluru airport
331.article_body: India's largest stockbroker Zerodha's CEO Nikhil Kamath has said that Bengaluru airport is not just the best one in India, but the best in the world. Praising Kempegowda International Airport's CEO Hari Marar, Kamath tweeted, "My friend...you've outdone yourself." He added, "Your (Marar's) vision and dedication to this city we...call home has made all of us so proud."

332.title: We had to change sanitary pads behind bushes during outdoor shoots: Jaya Bachchan
332.article_body: Veteran actress Jaya Bachchan recalled the time when there were no vanity vans for actors and no facilities at outdoor locations. She added that they had to change everything behind the bushes, including sanitary pads. "You...carried plastic bags to discard the pads and put them in...basket so that when you get home, you can get rid of it," Jaya stated.

333.title: Raj woman gang-raped in front of husband by 4 men; 3 accused held
333.article_body: A 45-year-old woman was allegedly gang-raped by four men in front of her husband in Rajasthan's Sirohi district, police said on Saturday. The four men had entered the couple's home with the intention to rob them, police added. "They stripped the man and took ₹1,400 from him," Pindwara DSP said. Three of the accused persons were arrested on Saturday.

334.title: World population to reach 8 billion mark in 3 days
334.article_body: The global population is projected to reach the 8 billion mark on 15 November 2022, the United Nations (UN) said. It added that India is projected to surpass China as the world's most populous country in 2023. The population of the world could reach 8.5 billion people in 2030 and by 2050, it will reach 9.7 billion, it said.

335.title: PM Modi-led govt doesn't sign FTA just for the sake of it: Piyush Goyal
335.article_body: Union Minister Piyush Goyal on Saturday said the Prime Minister Narendra Modi-led BJP government doesn't sign Free Trade Agreements (FTAs) just for the sake of it. "India's interests are weighed upon...We analyse whether it is fair and equitable," Goyal said. "In the past several deals were struck, but without keeping India's interest in mind," he further said.

336.title: Pakistan bowling performances are way better than India: Inzamam
336.article_body: Former cricketer Inzamam-ul-Haq said that the Pakistan team's bowling performances in the T20 World Cup in Australia have been "way better" than Indian ones. "India face problems whenever there is a big match and I have been observing this since the Asia Cup...However, we will not perform like this (India's performance against England) in the final," Inzamam said.

337.title: Will not support MVA panel in SPPU senate polls: Congress
337.article_body: The Congress party students' wing has extended support to 'Chhatrapati Shahu Maharaj Parivartan' (CSMP) for Savitribai Phule Pune University's (SPPU) management council senate polls, instead of the Maha Vikas Aghadi (MVA). The CSMP is formed by independent candidates. Congress student leaders said Shiv Sena and Nationalist Congress Party did not consult them while finalising list of candidates.

338.title: 15 trees chopped off in Greater Noida without forest department nod
338.article_body: More than 15 trees were felled in Greater Noida's Sector Beta 2 on Friday without prior permission from the forest department, residents said. Residents and environmental activists have alleged that the trees were felled by some of the residents themselves. Greater Noida Authority officials said that they are trying to identify the residents involved in the felling of the trees.

339.title: 2 die, including 13-yr-old boy, after jeep overturns in Rajasthan
339.article_body: Two people were killed when the jeep in which they were travelling overturned after one of its tyres burst in the Manpur area of Dausa, Rajasthan. The deceased were identified as Shubham (13) and Lalluram (55), police said. The jeep was carrying school students for a picnic. Notably, five other people, including four students, were injured in the accident.

340.title: India is going to be global superpower in 25 years: Piyush Goyal
340.article_body: Union Minister Piyush Goyal on Saturday said that the world has recognised that "India has arrived". "The headline is India is going to be a global superpower in next 25 years," Goyal said. "Every statistics...will clearly show you upward of a $30 trillion economy when we celebrate 100 years of Independence," he further added.

341.title: Bike-borne men fake an accident to extort ₹15,000 from B'luru car owner
341.article_body: Police arrested two men on Saturday for allegedly faking an accident and extorting ₹15,000 from the owner of a car in Bengaluru. A CCTV footage showed the men hitting the car with their hands as the four-wheeler passed their bike. Later, they allegedly demanded money from the victim and threatened to file a complaint against him for dashing their bike.

342.title: Had rejected Salman for Maine Pyar Kiya after 1st screen test: Sooraj
342.article_body: Filmmaker Sooraj Barjatya, in an interview, revealed that Salman Khan was rejected for 'Maine Pyar Kiya' after his first screen test. "But there was something about him. So, five months later, we got him on board," he added. Sooraj further said his first script for the film was rejected and it took him two years to write a new one.

343.title: Bengaluru airport is now second-largest in India: Karnataka CM
343.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai on Friday said that with the inauguration of Terminal 2 of Bengaluru's Kempegowda International Airport, the airport has become the second-largest airport in India. The terminal, spread over an area of 2,55,645 square metres, has been built at a cost of around ₹5,000 crore. It is expected to double the passenger handling capacity of the airport.

344.title: 1.5 kg heroin packed in soap cases seized in Assam's Karimganj, 1 held
344.article_body: The Assam Police on Friday night seized 1.5 kg heroin and arrested one person in Karimganj district, police said. In the operation led by the Additional Superintendent of Police of Karimganj, they seized heroin packed in 117 soap cases, police added. "The market value of the seized drugs is estimated at around ₹5 crore," police said.

345.title: Remains of NASA spacecraft found 37 years after it exploded & killed 7 astronauts
345.article_body: NASA has confirmed the discovery of the debris from its Challenger space shuttle which had exploded 73 seconds after liftoff on 28 January 1986, killing all seven astronauts onboard. Remains of the World War II-era aircraft were found after a TV documentary crew spotted an artifact on the seafloor off the coast of Florida in the US in May.

346.title: Actor Siddhaanth Vir Surryavanshi cremated in Mumbai; daughter performs last rites
346.article_body: Actor Siddhaanth Vir Surryavanshi, who passed away at the age of 46 on Friday, was cremated in Mumbai on Saturday. Siddhaanth's 18-year-old daughter Diza performed her father's last rites. Several actors including Jay Bhanushali, Arti Singh, Jaswir Kaur, Rohit K Verma, Vivek Mushran and Amit Behl attended the funeral.

347.title: Irfan Pathan responds to Pakistan PM's 'This Sunday, it is 152/0 vs 170/0' tweet
347.article_body: Ex-India all-rounder Irfan Pathan responded to Pakistan PM Shehbaz Sharif's 'So, this Sunday, it's 152/0 vs 170/0' tweet. Irfan tweeted, "The difference between us is that we're happy with ourselves, while you look for happiness when others are in trouble. That's why you aren't concentrating on your country's well-being." Sharif had referred to India's 10-wicket losses against Pakistan & England.

348.title: Sisodia changed 140 phones to destroy evidence in Delhi liquor policy scam: ED
348.article_body: Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia and other 'VIPs' accused in the Delhi liquor policy scam case changed 140 phones to destroy digital evidence linked to the case, the Enforcement Directorate (ED) has said. Around 30 people have been accused of involvement. The agency also said the liquor policy was "leaked" to some liquor manufacturers much before it was introduced.

349.title: Rachakonda Police grow Miyawaki plantation with 40,000 saplings
