349.article_body: Rachakonda Police Commissioner MM Bhagwat on Friday visited a Miyawaki plantation in Hyderabad, where he had planted 40,000 saplings 15 months ago. The plantation now has turned into a dense forest spread over four acres and the saplings have now grown to a height of 15 feet. "They were grown with a 100% drip irrigation facility," Bhagwat said.

350.title: Inflation above 6% can be detrimental to India's growth: RBI Guv Das
350.article_body: RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das said that inflation between 4% and 6% can help the central bank keep the monetary policy supportive of the economy. "Any inflation above 6% can be detrimental to India's growth," Das added. He further said that RBI expects October's inflation rates to be below 7%. "Macroeconomic fundamentals of India remain strong and resilient," Das said.

351.title: Indian Reserve Battalion personnel kills colleague in Arunachal
351.article_body: An Indian Reserve Battalion (IRBn) personnel deployed at Rajiv Gandhi University in Arunachal Pradesh's Doimukh, near Itanagar, allegedly shot dead one of his colleagues, police said. According to police, a head constable of 2nd IRBn Diyun fired two rounds at the victim, purportedly after a heated argument on Friday. Police have dismissed the theory that the accused was mentally unstable.

352.title: 11-yr-old boy dies after compound wall of bus depot falls on him in Palghar
352.article_body: A boy died and another got injured after a portion of the compound wall at Jawhar bus depot in Palghar, Maharashtra, fell on them. The 11-year-old deceased and the 15-year-old injured were waiting for an autorickshaw near the compound wall when a bus hit the wall, police said. Both boys belonged to the same family and had come from Rajkot.

353.title: Jaipur International Airport Ltd receives aerodrome licence from DGCA
353.article_body: Jaipur International Airport Limited (JIAL) has received the aerodrome licence from the Directorate General of Civil Aviation (DGCA). Prior to this, the Airport Authority of India (AAI) was the licence holder. Adani Group, which is operating the Jaipur airport since October 2021, has become the new licence holder. The company said that it is now looking for expansion.

354.title: Pantaloons offers Flat 30%* off amid Mid Season Sale
354.article_body: Pantaloons shared that its Mid Season Sale featuring deals & offers at flat 30%* off is live from 11th November to 27th November. The brand aims to encourage customers to wear latest fashionable outfits, and choose from a wide range of categories like shirts, dresses, footwear & more. This offer is valid on select range of their exclusive brands.

355.title: Don't make it a political issue: Anil Agarwal on shifting Foxconn plant to Guj
355.article_body: On shifting the Foxconn semiconductor plant from Maharashtra to Gujarat, Vedanta Chairman Anil Agarwal warned against the politicisation of the issue. Speaking at the Hindustan Times Leadership Summit, Agarwal said, "A complete ecosystem has to be created...We are just making fundamental raw materials...Please don't make it a political issue. India is one and let us make the raw material."

356.title: EC subverted to an extent that it's no more an independent body: Mufti
356.article_body: PDP chief Mehbooba Mufti on Saturday accused the BJP of subverting the Election Commission to an extent that it was no more an independent body. "Our election commissioners were invited by other countries to seek...advice on conducting elections," Mufti said. Elections in Jammu and Kashmir will be held only when the BJP gives a go ahead for it, Mufti added.

357.title: BMC to float tender for reconstruction of Mumbai's Gokhale bridge
357.article_body: After the closure of Gokhale bridge, Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) said the tenders for constructing the new bridge will be floated on Saturday. "IIT Bombay has already cleared the General Arrangement Drawings (GAD) and we're expecting to issue...work order by...first week of December," a BMC official said. The construction of the new bridge will reportedly take around six-seven months.

358.title: Startups should give solutions for India's logistics ecosystem: Sitharaman
358.article_body: While addressing YourStory's TechSparks event, India's Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said that startups should give solutions for India's logistics ecosystem, storage and preservations, adding that there are so many areas where India needs innovation. "Startups in India must think about sources of financing, platform for growth...people to engage with," Sitharaman added.

359.title: NGT seeks Punjab govt's reply on 'noise pollution' by CNG pump
359.article_body: National Green Tribunal (NGT) has sought a reply from the Punjab government over the alleged noise pollution caused by a CNG pump station situated on Zirakpur-Banur road. A plea had claimed that the huge noise caused by the CNG pump station is an underestimated threat. The plea also sought the issuance of directions to the state to shift the pump.

360.title: Amazon to review unprofitable units, workers told to find other jobs in firm: Report
360.article_body: Amazon is going to review its unprofitable businesses and has asked employees to look for other jobs in the company, Daily Mail reported. A software engineer at Amazon Robotics AI, Jamie Zhang, posted on LinkedIn that he and his entire team have been fired. Amazon's Alexa business recorded an operating loss of over $5 billion a year, the report mentioned.

361.title: Delhi woman tries to sacrifice 2-month-old kid to bring back her dead dad
361.article_body: In a bid to "bring back" her dead father, a woman kidnapped a two-month-old child in Delhi and tried to sacrifice the infant. She was stopped by the police. Police said that the child was safely rescued. The woman was earlier also involved in other crimes, police added. She had met the baby's mother at Safdarjung Hospital.

362.title: DRI arrests Indian with 5 kg heroin worth ₹35 cr at Mumbai airport
362.article_body: The Directorate of Revenue Intelligence (DRI) arrested an Indian national carrying 4.98 kg of heroin worth ₹35 crore at the Mumbai international airport. The accused, travelling from Nairobi to Mumbai, had concealed the narcotics in a false cavity created in his trolley bag. The DRI said a further investigation is underway to unearth and neutralise the international drug smuggling syndicate.

363.title: Bipasha Basu shares first post after welcoming baby girl; names her 'Devi'
363.article_body: Actress Bipasha Basu took to Instagram to share first post after welcoming baby girl with her husband, actor Karan Singh Grover. Revealing that they named her 'Devi Basu Singh Grover', the couple wrote, "Physical manifestation of our love and blessings of Ma is here...and she's Divine." The post also included a picture showing Bipasha and Karan holding Devi's feet.

364.title: Preity Zinta celebrates 18 years of 'Veer-Zaara', pens note
364.article_body: Actress Preity Zinta took to Instagram on Saturday to share a post marking 18 years since the release of her musical-drama film 'Veer-Zaara'. "There have been movies and there will be movies but nothing compares to Veer-Zaara...Thank you Aditya Chopra for creating the world of Veer-Zaara," she wrote. The Yash Chopra directorial also starred Shah Rukh Khan and Rani Mukerji.

365.title: Jairam Thakur will continue to be the CM face in Himachal: JP Nadda
365.article_body: BJP chief JP Nadda confirmed that the current Chief Minister of Himachal Pradesh, Jairam Thakur, will continue to be the CM face of the state if the party wins the Assembly polls. "We definitely are in a comfortable majority...[Congress] will gain nothing in Himachal Pradesh and Gujarat. Once they feel they are winning...they all will come...for credit," Nadda said.

366.title: Cong promises to rename Narendra Modi stadium in Gujarat manifesto
366.article_body: Congress on Saturday released its manifesto for the upcoming Gujarat elections and promised to rename Narendra Modi stadium in Ahmedabad. "The name of Sardar Patel stadium was changed...We want to assure the people of Gujarat that in the very first cabinet meeting, we will restore the name of the stadium to Sardar Patel stadium," a Congress leader said.

367.title: School manager booked for raping student in Ghaziabad
367.article_body: An FIR was registered against a school manager in Ghaziabad on Friday for allegedly raping a student, police said. The manager, Shahadat, has been accused of raping the girl repeatedly after school time over a period of two months, as per media reports. The accused is absconding, police informed. Raids are reportedly being conducted at his possible hideouts.

368.title: BJP should make Sukesh Chandrashekhar party president: Kejriwal
368.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal said on Saturday the BJP should make alleged conman Sukesh Chandrashekhar the party's national president. "The BJP demands my lie-detector test and even Sukesh Chandrashekhar makes the same demand. They speak the same language. He is fully trained to join the BJP now," Kejriwal said. Chandrashekhar is the main accused in an extortion case.

369.title: Going forward, digital currency will be less costly: RBI Governor
369.article_body: RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das said digital currency will be less costly in the coming times and will be important for cross-border transactions and payments. Speaking at Hindustan Times Leadership Summit, Das said, "You have to keep pace with times...printing of paper notes, it involves cost—cost of printing, buying paper, logistics, storage...Going forward, digital currency will be less costly."

370.title: They are all going to be superhit films: SRK on 'Jawan', 'Dunki' & 'Pathaan'
370.article_body: Shah Rukh Khan, when asked if he's nervous about his upcoming films 'Pathaan', 'Dunki' and 'Jawan', said, "I don't think I need to be nervous." He added that they are all going to be superhit films. Shah Rukh further said it's not an "arrogant statement", adding, "It's...child-like belief that 'look...I've done my best, I'm going to pass with flying colours'."

371.title: Nitin Gadkari sanctions 7 projects worth ₹10,222 crore for Tripura
371.article_body: Union Minister of Road, Transport and Highways Nitin Gadkari sanctioned seven projects worth ₹10,222 crore in Tripura. "These projects will strengthen connectivity between Tripura and other northeastern states, including neighbouring Bangladesh," said Gadkari. He also directed the state government to speed up the process of land acquisition for the expedition of the schemes.

372.title: 105-yr-old Naro Devi casts vote in Chamba's Churah in Himachal polls
372.article_body: Naro Devi, a 105-year-old woman, cast her vote in Himachal Pradesh on Saturday. She cast her vote at booth number 122 in Churah Assembly constituency located in Chamba. She decided to cast her vote at polling station despite an option of casting vote through ballot paper at home as directed by the Election Commission to all voters aged above 80.

373.title: New Zealand-based commercial lawyer Greg Barclay re-elected as Independent Chair of ICC
373.article_body: The ICC Board has unanimously re-elected Greg Barclay as the Independent Chair of the International Cricket Council (ICC) for a second two-year term. Barclay was unopposed following the withdrawal of Tavengwa Mukuhlani from the process. Barclay, an Auckland-based commercial lawyer, was originally appointed as the ICC Chair in November 2020.

374.title: Economy remains resilient, India to grow by 7% this year: RBI Guv
374.article_body: RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das said the Indian economy remains resilient and added that the central bank estimates that India will grow this year by 7%. "The growth numbers are looking good...IMF has projected that India will grow by about 6.8% in the current year...that puts India among the fastest growing major economies in the world," Das said at an event.

375.title: LockBit 3.0 hackers posted company data on 'publication platform': Thales
375.article_body: French defence and technology group Thales has said its data has been released on the "publication platform" of hacker group LockBit 3.0. The company said that there has been no intrusion of its IT systems at this stage, adding that there is currently no impact on its operations. The group has identified one of two likely sources of data theft.

376.title: Alibag tehsildar, agent caught by ACB for accepting bribe of ₹2 lakh
376.article_body: The Anti Corruption Bureau (ACB) of the Navi Mumbai unit caught a tehsildar, Minal Dalavi, of Alibag and one of her agents, Rakesh Chavan, for accepting a bribe of ₹2 lakh. According to reports, the complainant was trying to get a 7/12 extract mutated in favour of his father-in-law. While Chavan has been nabbed, Minal is yet to be arrested.

377.title: Men carrying ₹3 cr gold paste in undergarments caught at Hyd airport
377.article_body: Customs officials have seized gold worth ₹3 crore from two passengers at Hyderabad's Rajiv Gandhi International Airport. Amir Khan and Mohd Qureshi, who had arrived at the airport from Dubai, had converted 5.5 kg of gold into paste form to avoid detection by authorities. They had concealed the gold in undergarments.

378.title: MUHS starts its 1st genetic lab & cancer research centre in Pune
378.article_body: Maharashtra University of Health Sciences (MUHS) on Friday launched its first genetic laboratory and cancer research centre, MUHS GeneHealth, in Pune to provide affordable care with additional discounts for patients from poor financial backgrounds. The facility was inaugurated by state Governor Bhagat Singh Koshyari. "Various tests will be conducted through this genetic lab," Koshyari said.

379.title: SRK stopped at Mumbai airport for carrying expensive watches; paid ₹6.83 lakh: Reports
379.article_body: Shah Rukh Khan was stopped at the Mumbai airport by customs officials as he returned from Sharjah, according to reports. The actor was carrying watches worth ₹18 lakh, reports added. Shah Rukh Khan, who was travelling in a chartered plane, was reportedly made to pay ₹6.83 lakh as customs duty.

380.title: BJP workers inspire me as they are fighting oppressive TRS govt: PM in T'gana
380.article_body: PM Narendra Modi criticised the ruling TRS government in Telangana, saying that BJP workers inspire him because they are fighting an oppressive state government. "The ruling party leaders have been indulging in unjust practices with the rich talents of the region. The party that the [people of the state] trusted has deceived them the most," said PM Modi.

381.title: Ukraine builds barbed-wired wall on border with Belarus: Kyiv
381.article_body: Ukraine has said that it was building a reinforced concrete wall and other fortifications along the border with Belarus, a Russian ally. Ukrainian Presidential advisor Kyrylo Tymoshenko said a 3 km barbed-wire-topped wall had been built on the border with Belarus. He added that sandbags and trenches have also been used and other work is also underway in the region.

382.title: Shoaib Malik linked with Pakistani actress Ayesha amid rumours of divorce with Sania
382.article_body: Pakistani cricketer Shoaib Malik has been linked with Pakistani actress Ayesha Omar amid rumours of divorce with Indian tennis player Sania Mirza. Pictures of Malik and Ayesha from an intimate photoshoot that was conducted last year have gone viral on social media. As per reports, Shoaib and Sania will announce their separation after resolving legal issues.

383.title: Rare 'sprite lightning' seen over Tropical Storm Nicole, footage surfaces
383.article_body: A photographer named Frankie Lucena captured a rare phenomenon called 'sprite lightning', which occurred amid Tropical Storm Nicole over Puerto Rico. 'Sprite lightning', which is also known as 'red lightning' because of its reddish hue, is formed from pent-up electricity in clouds shooting vertically. Lucena shared a video of the phenomenon on Twitter.

384.title: 2 high-speed bikes collide into one another in MP, video surfaces
384.article_body: A video has surfaced from Madhya Pradesh's Jabalpur showing a collision between two speeding bikes on Thursday. The video shows one of the riders being thrown away at a distance from his bike. The accident happened as the speeding biker couldn't stop at an intersection when the second two-wheeler was crossing it. Both the riders are reportedly out of danger.

385.title: Meta layoffs were 'more thoughtful' than Twitter under Musk, says Zuckerberg: Report
385.article_body: Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg believes the company handled mass layoffs better than Twitter after Elon Muk's takeover, a Business Insider report has said. At a company townhall meeting, Zuckerberg said Musk 'clearly didn't have the time to plan the layoffs as thoughtfully as a lot of other companies including Meta'. Twitter fired 3,700 employees while Meta cut over 11,000 jobs.

386.title: Fake currency note racket busted in Thane; ₹8 cr seized, 2 arrested
386.article_body: The Thane Police on Saturday busted a fake currency racket from Wagle Estate and arrested two persons in connection with the case. The police have recovered ₹8 crore worth fake currency from the arrested persons. They recovered 400 bundles of fake notes of ₹2000 from the possession of the accused.

387.title: Delhi's min temp reaches 12.6°C, air quality remains 'very poor'
387.article_body: Delhi's temperature started dipping and was recorded at 12.6 degrees Celsius early on Saturday, a day after the minimum temperature of 14.6 degrees Celsius was recorded. Saturday's temperature was a notch below the season's average. Meanwhile, air quality remained in the 'very poor' category with the overall Air Quality Index (AQI) recorded at 311 at 9 am, CPCB data showed.

388.title: India to be among top 3 economic powers in 10-15 yrs: FM Sitharaman
388.article_body: India has emerged as one of the fastest-growing major economies in the world and is expected to be one of the top three economic powers globally in the next 10-15 years, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said. She added that the Indian economy is not insulated from the impact of global economic developments as the global economic outlook remains challenging.

389.title: He set off my bullshit detector: Musk on FTX ex-CEO who offered him $3 bn to buy Twitter
389.article_body: Commenting on FTX ex-CEO Sam Bankman-Fried, who once expressed his interest in investing in Elon Musk's bid for Twitter, the Tesla CEO tweeted, "He set off my bullshit detector." Musk's banker on the Twitter deal had informed him that Bankman-Fried was offering "at least $3 billion" to help him buy Twitter. FTX filed for bankruptcy on Friday.

390.title: Woman injured in chain snatching incident in Hyderabad's Punjagutta
390.article_body: A woman sustained injuries on her neck when bike-borne men snatched a gold chain weighing three tolas from her in Hyderabad's Punjagutta on Thursday. The incident took place around 2:30 pm when the woman, Vastavayi Neeraja, was standing near her apartment building. Based on her complaint, the police have booked a case and an investigation is underway.

391.title: India's industrial output reports 3.1% growth in September
391.article_body: India's industrial output, measured through the Index of Industrial Production (IIP), witnessed a 3.1% growth in September, data released by the Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation showed on Friday. Earlier in August, output had contracted by 0.8%. As per the data, the mining, manufacturing and electricity sectors grew at 4.6%, 1.8% and 11.6%, respectively.

392.title: Arjun, Bhumi & Rakul to star in comedy film 'Mere Husband Ki Biwi': Report
392.article_body: Actors Arjun Kapoor, Bhumi Pednekar and Rakul Preet Singh are set to star in a comedy movie titled 'Mere Husband Ki Biwi', according to a report. "It's a tale of a protagonist and the humour arises from the situation of [him]...being stuck in a love triangle," a source was quoted as saying. The film will reportedly be released in 2023.

393.title: Comeback in last 4 matches has given us confidence: Babar ahead of T20 WC final
393.article_body: Pakistan captain Babar Azam has said their comeback in the last four matches has given them confidence ahead of the 2022 T20 World Cup final against England on Sunday. "We're confident and we also have the belief to do well," he added. Pakistan won four consecutive games to reach the final after losing their opening two games in the tournament.

394.title: Class 12 B'luru boy plays 'Vande Mataram' on flute on Vande Bharat train
394.article_body: A video of a Bengaluru boy playing the 'Vande Mataram' tune on his flute while on board South India's first Vande Bharat Express train has emerged on social media. The video, posted by railway bureaucrat Ananth Rupanagudi, showed Class 12 student Aprameya Seshadri playing the flute as other passengers listened intently. A netizen commented, "I love this Vande Bharat initiative."

395.title: Congress releases Gujarat poll manifesto, promises 10 lakh govt jobs
395.article_body: The Congress on Saturday released its manifesto for the upcoming Gujarat Assembly elections. The party has promised to provide 10 lakh government jobs, ₹3,000 unemployment allowance, gas cylinders at ₹500 and 300 units of free electricity if it comes to power in the state. The party also tweeted that it will stop the "mindless" privatisation of education and healthcare sectors.

396.title: Stop Russia from playing hunger games: Ukrainian minister to ASEAN
396.article_body: Ukrainian Foreign Minister Dmytro Kuleba has urged ASEAN members to take every step to stop Russia from playing "hunger games" over Black Sea grain deal. The deal signed between Russia and Ukraine could end soon if either of the signatories objects to an extension. Kuleba said it is important to make sure that Russia doesn't cause "artificial delays" in shipment.

397.title: Man, his aide hacked to death by group of men in Pune; FIR filed
397.article_body: An FIR has been filed after a group of men allegedly hacked a man and his aide to death in Pune, officers said. The man, who was convicted of firing a gun at a hotelier in 2008, was released from jail after completing his punishment, police said. Prima facie, police suspect duo was murdered to avenge the attack, officers added.

398.title: Kerala RPF officer saves girl from getting crushed under train; video shared
398.article_body: An RPF officer saved a minor girl from falling and getting crushed under a moving train in Kerala. A video of the incident was shared by RPF India. The video shows the girl running to board the train but falling down as she attempts to get inside the door. The RPF officer is seen catching hold of her.

399.title: We're too critical of our players: Uthappa on KL Rahul's criticism over form
399.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Robin Uthappa has said people are being too critical of players following India's semi-final exit from the 2022 T20 WC. On KL Rahul registering single-digit scores against Pakistan, SA and England, Uthappa said, "In all of India's T20I victories, Rahul's got the second or third highest number of fifties. You can't say he's not performing in big matches."

400.title: Bipasha Basu, Karan Singh Grover blessed with a baby girl
400.article_body: Actress Bipasha Basu and actor Karan Singh Grover have been blessed with their first child. Basu delivered a baby girl on Saturday. The duo had announced in August that they are expecting their first child together. The couple, who had first met on the sets of 'Alone' which released in 2015, got married in April 2016.

401.title: Old sandals worn by Steve Jobs receive bids of over ₹17 lakh at auction
401.article_body: An old pair of Birkenstock sandals worn by Apple co-founder Steve Jobs in the 1970s and 80s are up for auction with bids of over $22,000 (around ₹17.7 lakh) received so far. The sandals, being sold by California-based Julien's Auction, are expected to fetch $60,000-$80,000 (around ₹48 lakh-₹64 lakh). They were previously owned by his house manager.

402.title: Hedge fund Galois Capital's assets worth $100 mn stuck on FTX: Report
402.article_body: Close to half the assets of hedge fund Galois Capital, estimated to be around $100 million, were trapped on collapsed crypto exchange FTX, the Financial Times reported. "I am deeply sorry that we find ourselves in this current situation," Galois Co-founder Kevin Zhou wrote to investors, adding that it could take "a few years" to recover "some percentage" of assets.
